thread.title: Sundell, USA hold lead in tournament at midway point | Sports | Maryville Forum
thread.title_full: Sundell, USA hold lead in tournament at midway point | Sports | Maryville Forum

author: JON DYKSTRA The Forum
title: Sundell, USA hold lead in tournament at midway point | Sports | Maryville Forum
text:
Midway through the week of competition in the FIBA 3x3 Nations League in Punta Arenas, Chile, Team USA leads with 270 tournament points, while Chile has 250, Canada has 230, Argentina has 170 and the Cayman Islands have 160.
The tournament has an off-day on Thursday before resuming action Friday, Saturday and Sunday.
After losing their first game of the tournament to Canada, the Americans have won seven-straight games. All the games are broadcast on "FIBA3x3 - The 3x3 Basketball Channel" on YouTube.
With six players, the US takes turns sitting two players each day.
Monday’s Stop USA not playing: Rachel Ullstrom & Zee Spearman
Canada 15, USA 13
Joyce Edwards led Team USA with five points while Serena Sundell had four, and Taylor Bigby and MiLaysia Fulwiley had two each.
USA 22, Cayman Islands 2
Edwards, Sundell and Bigby each had six points and Fulwiley added four in a bounce-back rout.
Third-Place Game: USA 21, Argentina 5
Edwards dropped 10 while Sundell had six, Bigby had three and Fulwiley had two.
Tuesday’s Stop USA not playing: Joyce Edwards & MiLaysia Fulwiley
USA 20, Argentina 14
Serena Sundell, Zee Spearman, Rachel Ullstrom and Taylor Bigby each scored five points in their lone pool-play game.
First-Place Game: USA 21, Canada 13
Spearman led the charge inside with 12 points while Ullstrom had five, and Sundell and Bigby each had two.
Wednesday’s Stop USA not playing: Serena Sundell & Taylor Bigby
USA 21, Canada 17
Joyce Edwards had 10 points while Rachel Ullstrom had six, Spearman had three and Fulwiley had two.
USA 21, Argentina 11
Ullstrom had seven points while Spearman had six, and Edwards and Fulwiley each added four.
First-Place Game: USA 18, Chile 15
Edwards scored seven and Fulwiley scored six. Spearman had three and Ullstrom had two.
